## Overview

You create an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INStartWorkoutIntentResponse] object in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INStartWorkoutIntentHandling/confirm(intent:completion:)] and [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INStartWorkoutIntentHandling/handle(intent:completion:)] methods of your start workout handler object. For more information about implementing your handler object, see [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INStartWorkoutIntentHandling].

# INStartWorkoutIntentResponse

**Class**

Your app’s response to a start workout intent.

## Declaration

```swift
class INStartWorkoutIntentResponse
```

## Overview

Use an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INStartWorkoutIntentResponse] object to specify whether your app is able to start a workout. The response object contains only the response code that indicates whether to launch your app or whether there was a problem.

You create an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INStartWorkoutIntentResponse] object in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INStartWorkoutIntentHandling/confirm(intent:completion:)] and [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INStartWorkoutIntentHandling/handle(intent:completion:)] methods of your start workout handler object. For more information about implementing your handler object, see [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INStartWorkoutIntentHandling].

## Initializing the Response Object

- **init(code:userActivity:)**: Initializes the response object with the specified code and user activity object.

## Getting the Response Code

- **code**: The code that indicates whether you successfully handled the intent.
- **INStartWorkoutIntentResponseCode**: Constants that indicate the response state.

## Start a Workout

- **INStartWorkoutIntentHandling**: An interface that handles requests to start a workout.
- **INStartWorkoutIntent**: A request to start a workout for the user.

## Inherits From

- INIntentResponse

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
